definitions.definition: Clean , tidy ; free from dirt or impurities.
examples: My room is neat because I tidied it this morning. She has very neat hair.

definitions.definition: Free from contaminants ; unadulterated , undiluted . Particularly of liquor and cocktails; see usage below.
( chemistry ) Conditions with a liquid reagent or gas performed with no standard solvent or cosolvent.
examples: The Arbuzov reaction is performed by adding the bromide to the phosphite, neat . The molecular beam was neat acetylene.

definitions.definition: ( archaic ) With all deductions or allowances made; net .
Having a simple elegance or style; clean, trim, tidy, tasteful .
examples: The front room was neat and carefully arranged for the guests.

definitions.definition: Well-executed or delivered; clever, skillful, precise.
examples: Having the two protagonists meet in the last act was a particularly neat touch.

definitions.definition: Facile ; missing complexity or details in the favor of convenience or simplicity .
examples: Courts should not reduce this case to a neat set of legal rules.

definitions.definition: ( Canada , US , colloquial ) Good , excellent , desirable ; interesting ; cool .
Obsolete form of net ( “ remaining after expenses or deductions ” ) .
